name: Sambal Belacan
flavor: A pungent and savory sambal with a strong umami taste.
description: Sambal Belacan is a classic Malaysian chili sauce known for its intense flavor. Made with a blend of red chilies, belacan (shrimp paste), garlic, and lime juice, it adds a bold umami kick to various dishes.

name: Sambal Tumis
flavor: Sweet and tangy, often used as a base for many Malaysian dishes.
description: Sambal Tumis is a versatile Malaysian chili sauce with a sweet and tangy flavor. Made with dried chilies, shallots, garlic, tamarind paste, and anchovies, it serves as a flavorful base for various Malaysian dishes.

name: Sambal Kicap
flavor: A sweet and slightly spicy sambal with the rich flavor of soy sauce.
description: Sambal Kicap is a Malaysian chili sauce known for its sweet and slightly spicy taste. Made with chilies, soy sauce, tamarind paste, and sugar, it offers a delightful balance of flavors with the richness of soy sauce.

name: Sambal Hijau
flavor: Fresh and vibrant, with a citrusy kick from lime juice.
description: Sambal Hijau is a refreshing Malaysian chili sauce with a fresh and vibrant flavor. Made with green chilies, cilantro, garlic, and lime juice, it adds a citrusy kick to enhance the taste of various dishes.

name: Sambal Cencalok
flavor: Unique and briny due to the fermented shrimp, adds depth to dishes.
description: Sambal Cencalok is a distinctive Malaysian chili sauce with a unique and briny flavor. Made with chilies, cencalok (fermented small shrimps), shallots, and lime juice, it adds depth to dishes with its fermented shrimp goodness.

name: Sambal Tempoyak
flavor: Creamy and pungent, the addition of durian gives it a distinct taste.
description: Sambal Tempoyak is a Malaysian chili sauce with a creamy and pungent flavor. Made with durian paste, chilies, anchovies, and lime leaves, it stands out with the unique addition of durian, offering a distinct and rich taste.

name: Sambal Udang Kering
flavor: Intensely savory and spicy, a common condiment in Malaysian cuisine.
description: Sambal Udang Kering is an intensely savory and spicy Malaysian chili sauce. Made with dried shrimp, dried chilies, shallots, and tamarind paste, it is a common condiment in Malaysian cuisine, adding bold flavors to various dishes.

name: Sambal Nenas
flavor: Sweet and tangy, the pineapple adds a refreshing twist.
description: Sambal Nenas is a Malaysian chili sauce with a sweet and tangy flavor. Made with pineapple, chilies, shallots, and tamarind paste, it offers a refreshing twist with the addition of pineapple, enhancing the overall taste.

name: Sambal Jeruk
flavor: Zesty and citrusy, often served as a dipping sauce.
description: Sambal Jeruk is a zesty and citrusy Malaysian chili sauce. Made with chilies, calamansi lime, sugar, and salt, it is often served as a dipping sauce to add a burst of citrusy flavor to various dishes.

name: Sambal Matah
flavor: Fresh and aromatic, commonly used in Indonesian and Malaysian cuisines.
description: Sambal Matah is a fresh and aromatic Malaysian chili sauce. Made with shallots, lemongrass, garlic, lime leaves, and bird's eye chilies, it is commonly used in Indonesian and Malaysian cuisines to add a burst of freshness to various dishes.
